page.title: 12Shops-Silverdale and Knutton
page.content: In the l950s there were about 80 shops in Silverdale.Now the centre of the village has been demolished and most of the old shops have gone.There are now less than 30 shops.Most of these are in the new shopping area called The Parade which has a bank,a computer cabin and a post office.We carried out a survey and discovered that most of our mothers shop at a supermarket in nearby Knutton or go to Newcastle-Under-Lyme,our nearest town.My grandad said he did his shopping every day when he was young because there were no fridges and food soon went bad. Knutton has a number of small village shops.There are six small general food shops and two off-licences.There are two fish and chips shops,always a favourite food,and a post office.There is only one very large supermarket in our area.
